We are in the early stages of planning rainbowR's *first ever conference*!

**Why are we having a conference?** To connect, support and promote LGBTQ+ folks who code in R, to raise awareness of LGBTQ+ issues through data-driven activism, to share our work with R, and to bolster the rainbowR community.

**When will the conference be?** Thursday February 26th, 2026. Potentially a day of workshops on Wednesday February 25th, 2026.

**Who is the conference for?** For LGBTQ+ folks who code in R, and allies, from across the world.

**What is the conference length?** 1/2 day or whole day for conference, 1/2 day or whole day for workshops.

**Where will the conference be?** Online.

**What will the conference consist of?** Regular and lightning talks, keynotes, and workshops.

**Who will have overall oversight of the conference?** Ella Kaye, supported by her Software Sustainability Institute fellowship.

**When can we find out more?** A conference website and call for abstracts should launch by early November.

If you'd like to discuss, get in touch with us: [hello@rainbowr.org](mailto:hello@rainbowr.org).
